description:
Designed by Langstaff Day Architects, The Corner House is a self-build, low energy sustainable CLT home on a constrained brownfield site in Stoke Newington overlooking Butterfield Green.
This is a sneak preview, with the home competing in the next few weeksâ€¦

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes: Maximum of 6 guest in the house at any one time.  One of the architects will be present through the day

events.name: Drop in
events.notes: Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email about any changes to the programme that might affect your visit.

factsheet.heading: Design
paragraphs: Built on the site of a small dilapidated storage shed, The Corner House uses every available metre to bring light into a three-storey home.

The house occupies an enviable position at the corner of Butterfield Green, allowing the first floor to open up to and peer through the trees whilst the rest of the house balances privacy with natural daylight.
The site's position brought planning complexity with it, and the form needed to respond to the constraints of a subservient rear garden that is also prominent corner plot.

The low energy house will be net zero once complete with two PV panels,  has an exposed engineered timber structure and is supported by sustainable technologies (including an exhaust air heat pump) to provide a comfortable and resilient internal environment.

The Corner House is a Langstaff Day Architects self-build project, and a home for modern inner city living; embracing the need for spaces that can be flexible for home working, guests staying and for studying.

images.title: The Corner House - due to complete in September 2024 - overlooking Butterfield Green on Milton Grove
View during construction from Butterfield Green

name: The Corner House
